entry.title: Security alert: Attack campaign involving stolen OAuth user tokens issued to two third-party integrators
entry.summary: On April 12, GitHub Security began an investigation that uncovered evidence that an attacker abused stolen OAuth user tokens issued to two third-party OAuth integrators, Heroku and Travis-CI, to download data from dozens of organizations, including npm. Read on to learn more about the impact to GitHub, npm, and our users.

entry.title: Dependabot alerts now surface if your code is calling a vulnerability
entry.summary: Today, we're shipping a new feature for Dependabot alerts which helps you better understand how you're affected by a vulnerability.

entry.title: Git security vulnerability announced
entry.summary: Upgrade your local installation of Git, especially if you are using Git for Windows, or you use Git on a multi-user machine.

entry.title: What’s new in GitHub Discussions: Organization Discussions, polls, and more
entry.summary: Today, we’re excited to bring you a few new features that will help you communicate, collaborate, and connect seamlessly with teams and communities about the software you’re building with the help of GitHub Discussions.

entry.title: Performance at GitHub: deferring stats with rack.after_reply
entry.summary: How we sped up GitHub.com by moving slow, non-critical code into rack.after_reply.

entry.title: Announcing TypeScript 4.7 Beta
entry.summary: Today we are excited to announce the beta release of TypeScript 4.7! You can also get editor support by Downloading for Visual Studio 2022/2019 The post Announcing TypeScript 4.7 Beta appeared first on TypeScript.

entry.title: Release Radar · March 2022 Edition
entry.summary: Each month, we highlight open source projects that have shipped major updates. These include everything from world-changing technology to developer tooling, and weekend projects. Here are our top staff picks on projects that shipped major version releases in March. Babylon.js 5.0 We featured Babylon.js in the November 2020 Release Radar. Since then, Babylon.js has come […]

entry.title: Git Credential Manager: authentication for everyone
entry.summary: Ensuring secure access to your source code is more important than ever. Git Credential Manager helps make that easy.

entry.title: Achieving SLSA 3 Compliance with GitHub Actions and Sigstore for Go modules
entry.summary: Learn how to build packages with SLSA 3 provenance using GitHub Actions.

entry.title: GitHub Availability Report: March 2022
entry.summary: In March, we experienced several incidents resulting in significant impact to multiple GitHub services.

entry.title: Prevent the introduction of known vulnerabilities into your code
entry.summary: The new dependency review action and API prevents the introduction of known supply chain vulnerabilities into your code.
